task.title: Share a Marketing Cloud folder
task.shortdesc: Share a Marketing Cloud folder with Creative Cloud users.

draft-comment.p: Alternative path: click Enter Selection Mode, click a folder, then click the CC icon

step.cmd: Click Assets, then click Add Folder.
On the new folder, click Share Using Creative Cloud.

stepresult.p: Alternatively, click Enter Selection Mode, click a folder, then click the Creative Cloud icon:

step.cmd: On the Share to Creative Cloud page, select a user, then click Add.

info.p: A shared asset on the Marketing Cloud Asset page is identified by the Creative Cloud logo on the folder.

step.cmd: Launch the Creative Cloud desktop (or navigate to the Creative Cloud Files page in a browser) and look for the request notification.
Open the request, then click Accept.
To access folder contents, click Open Folder (or View on Web).
Continue by adding comments on the shared asset:

stepresult.p: In Creative Cloud, you can click into an image, then click Activity to add a comment on the image. Comments are synced on the assets in the Creative Cloud and Marketing Cloud.
In the Marketing Cloud, click into an image, then click the time-line icon to add a comment on the image. Comments are synced on the assets in the Creative Cloud and Marketing Cloud.

draft-comment.p: You can unshare a folder. On Share to Creative Cloud, click Remove, then click Update. The blue creative cloud icon disappears. Tasks: Accept invitations, share, unshare, add comments.
Turn assets into cards for annotation (tie into that MAC feature).

In Social, (Asset Selector) and publish a social post to FB or twitter, go to Publisher, the Import from Assets brings a page overlay of MAC assets. You can search for a particular folder, browse to it, and attach the asset to a post.

Target integration: Launch Target (bullseye), Create Activity, name it, click Continue, specify activity URL, then Swap Image, Target has a similar asset selector and replace an image in a Target Activity/experience. (Or Insert Element to load a shared/MAC asset to Target.) When creating activities in Adobe Target, you can load or swap shared assets from the Content Library.

step.cmd: To un-share a folder, click Share Using Creative Cloud (similar to Step 3), then remove users by clicking X, then click Share.

stepresult.p: Once you have removed all Creative Cloud Users, the folder is un-shared and the Creative Cloud users no longer has access.

postreq.p: Additional ways to use a shared asset include:

ul.li: Use assets in the Asset Selector in Adobe Social for social posts. See Publisher Page.

Load or swap assets in the
Content Library in Adobe Target for images in activities.
